original: de nyid kyis na dbang po la sogs pa thams cad kyis gnon pas na rdo rje chen po 'chang ba'o //üîΩsems can drag po rnams la de'i gzugs kyis 'dul bar mdzad pas na drag po chen po'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na dbang po la sogs pa thams cad kyis gnon pas na rdo rje chen po 'chang ba'o // sems can drag po rnams la de'i gzugs kyis 'dul bar mdzad pas na drag po chen po'o //
translated: He is the wielder of the great vajra because he conquers all, such as the faculties.üîΩHe is the great fierce one because he tames the fierce sentient beings by means of his form.

original: sems can ma rungs pa rnams gdul ba'i phyir drag shul can gyi gzugs 'dzin pas na drag shul chen po'o //
analyzed: sems can ma rungs pa rnams gdul ba'i phyir drag shul can gyi gzugs 'dzin pas na drag shul chen po'o //
translated: He is the great wrathful one because he assumes the form of a wrathful one in order to tame the wicked sentient beings.

original: 'jigs pa chen po ni seng ge la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa chen po ni seng ge la sogs pa ste /
translated: The great fear is the lion and so forth.

original: de rnams 'jigs par mdzad pas na 'jigs chen 'jigs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams 'jigs par mdzad pas na 'jigs chen 'jigs par byed pa'o //
translated: He is the one who causes fear of the great fear because he causes fear of them.

original: ye shes kyi dbang phyug dang ldan pas na mgon po'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi dbang phyug dang ldan pas na mgon po'o //
translated: He is the protector because he possesses the sovereignty of gnosis.

original: rma bya chen mo la sogs pa rig sngags kyi mchog tu gyur pas na rig mchog chen po'o //
analyzed: rma bya chen mo la sogs pa rig sngags kyi mchog tu gyur pas na rig mchog chen po'o //
translated: He is the great supreme knowledge because he is the supreme knowledge mantra, such as the great peacock and so forth.

original: dam pa'i chos nye bar ston pas na bla ma'o //üîΩgsang sngags chen po ni yig 'bru la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nye bar ston pas na bla ma'o // gsang sngags chen po ni yig 'bru la sogs pa'o //
translated: He is the guru because he teaches the sublime Dharma.üîΩThe great mantra is the syllables and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi dam par gyur pas na gsang sngags chen po'i mchog ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dam par gyur pas na gsang sngags chen po'i mchog ste /
translated: He is the supreme of the great mantras because he is the supreme of those.

original: yig ge aa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yig ge aa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of the letter A.

original: theg pa chen po'i tshul ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i lugs te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshul ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i lugs te /
translated: The Mahayana way is the way of the perfections.

original: de la gnas pas na theg pa chen po'i tshul la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pas na theg pa chen po'i tshul la gnas pa'o //
translated: Because he is established in that, he is established in the Mahayana way.

original: ci'i phyir de la gnas she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de la gnas she na /
translated: Why is he established in that?

original: ji ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa las theg pa chen po'i tshul mchog tu gyur pas na de la gnas pa'i phyir theg pa chen po'i tshul gyi mchog go //
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa las theg pa chen po'i tshul mchog tu gyur pas na de la gnas pa'i phyir theg pa chen po'i tshul gyi mchog go //
translated: Because the Mahayana way is superior to the ways of the Disciples and Solitary Buddhas, he is established in that, so he is the supreme of the Mahayana way.

original: chos thams cad thugs su chud pas na sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: chos thams cad thugs su chud pas na sangs rgyas so //
translated: He is the Buddha because he has realized all phenomena.

original: 'khor gyi dbus na shas cher mdzes pas na rnam par snang mdzad de snang bas na zhes pa'i bar du'o //üîΩsku gsung thugs thub pas na thub pa chen po'o //
analyzed: 'khor gyi dbus na shas cher mdzes pas na rnam par snang mdzad de snang bas na zhes pa'i bar du'o // sku gsung thugs thub pas na thub pa chen po'o //
translated: He is Vairocana because he is very beautiful in the midst of the retinue, up to ‚Äúbecause of illumination.‚ÄùüîΩHe is the Great Sage because he is the sage of body, speech, and mind.

original: lha dang drang srong gi mchog tu @8b gyur pas na thub chen ldan no //
analyzed: lha dang drang srong gi mchog tu @8b gyur pas na thub chen ldan no //
translated: He is the possessor of great sages because he is the supreme of gods and sages.

original: stong pa nyid sngon du 'gro bas sa bon dang phyag mtshan gyi rim gyis lha'i skur bskyed pas na gsang sngags tshul chen las byung ba'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid sngon du 'gro bas sa bon dang phyag mtshan gyi rim gyis lha'i skur bskyed pas na gsang sngags tshul chen las byung ba'o //
translated: It is born from the great way of mantra because it is generated as the body of the deity through the stages of the seed and the insignia, preceded by emptiness.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis de'i tshul gyi bdag nyid can yin pas na gsang sngags tshul chen bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis de'i tshul gyi bdag nyid can yin pas na gsang sngags tshul chen bdag nyid can no //
translated: It is the nature of the great way of mantra because it is the nature of that way.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The ten perfections are as follows:

original: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / thabs dang / smon lam dang / stobs dang / ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid de /üîΩpha rol tu phyin pa de rnams bsnyes pas na pha rol tu phyin pa bcu thob pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / thabs dang / smon lam dang / stobs dang / ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid de / pha rol tu phyin pa de rnams bsnyes pas na pha rol tu phyin pa bcu thob pa ste /
translated: Generosity, morality, patience, effort, meditative stabilization, wisdom, skillful-means, aspiration, strength, and pristine wisdom.üîΩHe is one who has attained the ten perfections because he has perfected those perfections.

original: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rdzogs par mdzad pas na pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' gzhan rnams kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rdzogs par mdzad pas na pha rol tu phyin pa bcu la gnas pa'o //
translated: He is one who abides in the ten perfections because he causes the perfections of other bodhisattvas who abide in them to be perfected.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu bstan pas sems can rnams kyi sems dga' ba bskyed pas pha rol phyin bcu dag pa ste'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu bstan pas sems can rnams kyi sems dga' ba bskyed pas pha rol phyin bcu dag pa ste'o //
translated: The ten perfections are taught, and the minds of sentient beings are gladdened, so the ten perfections are purified.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i tshul ni chen po ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bcu'i tshul ni chen po ste /
translated: The way of the ten perfections is great.

original: de la gnas pa'i sems can rnams tshul de la rab tu 'jog pas na pha rol phyin pa bcu'i tshul lo //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i sems can rnams tshul de la rab tu 'jog pas na pha rol phyin pa bcu'i tshul lo //
translated: Sentient beings who abide in that way are well-established in that way, so it is the way of the ten perfections.

original: yon tan gyi dbang phyug dang ldan pas na mgon po'o //
analyzed: yon tan gyi dbang phyug dang ldan pas na mgon po'o //
translated: Endowed with the lordship of qualities, he is the lord.

original: sa bcu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sa bcu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The ten stages are as follows:

original: rab tu dga' ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang / 'od 'phro ba dang / shin tu sbyangs dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / legs pa'i blo gros dang /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba dang / dri ma med pa dang / 'od byed pa dang / 'od 'phro ba dang / shin tu sbyangs dka' ba dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / ring du song ba dang / mi g-yo ba dang / legs pa'i blo gros dang /
translated: The Joyful, the Stainless, the Shining, the Blazing, the Difficult to Master, the Manifested, the Gone Afar, the Immovable, the Excellent Intelligence,

original: chos kyi sprin te /
analyzed: chos kyi sprin te /
translated: and the Cloud of Dharma.

original: sa de rnams kyi gtso bor gyur pa dang ldan pas na sa bcu'i dbang phyug go //
analyzed: sa de rnams kyi gtso bor gyur pa dang ldan pas na sa bcu'i dbang phyug go //
translated: Endowed with the chief of those stages, he is the lord of the ten stages.

original: sa bcu rnams la sems 'jog bar mdzad pas na sa bcu la ni gnas pa po'o //
analyzed: sa bcu rnams la sems 'jog bar mdzad pas na sa bcu la ni gnas pa po'o //
translated: He who places the mind on the ten stages is one who abides on the ten stages.

original: shes pa bcu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shes pa bcu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The ten knowledges are as follows:

original: sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa shes pa dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun 'byung shes pa dang / 'gog pa shes pa dang / lam shes pa dang / zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang / chos shes pa dang / rjes su rtogs pa shes pa dang /
translated: the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of origin, the knowledge of cessation, the knowledge of the path, the knowledge of extinction, the knowledge of non-arising, the knowledge of phenomena, the subsequent knowledge,

original: kun rdzob shes pa dang / 'dris pa shes pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa dang / 'dris pa shes pa dang / sgra ji bzhin pa shes pa'o //
translated: the conventional knowledge, the knowledge of acquaintance, and the knowledge in accordance with sound.

original: shes pa bcu po de rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni shes bcu rnam dag bdag nyid can no //üîΩshes pa bcu rnam par dag pa'i sems dri ma med pa'i tshul gyis rtag tu @9a * //
analyzed: shes pa bcu po de rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i bdag nyid kyi ngo bo gang yin pa de ni shes bcu rnam dag bdag nyid can no // shes pa bcu rnam par dag pa'i sems dri ma med pa'i tshul gyis rtag tu @9a * //
translated: The essence of the pure nature of these ten knowledges is the one who possesses the pure nature of the ten knowledges.

original: 'dzin pas na shes bcu rnam dag 'chang ba po'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pas na shes bcu rnam dag 'chang ba po'o //
translated: Because he always holds the stainless mind of the ten pure knowledges, he is the one who holds the ten pure knowledges.

original: rnam pa bcu ni bden pa bcu ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu ni bden pa bcu ste /
translated: The ten aspects are the ten truths.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don mad pa'i bden pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi bden pa dang / rnam par phye ba'i bden pa dang / nges par bye ste rtogs pa'i bden pa dang / dngos po'i bden pa dang / rab tu 'byung ba'i bden pa dang /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang / don mad pa'i bden pa dang / mtshan nyid kyi bden pa dang / rnam par phye ba'i bden pa dang / nges par bye ste rtogs pa'i bden pa dang / dngos po'i bden pa dang / rab tu 'byung ba'i bden pa dang /
translated: the truth of the conventional, the truth of the ultimate, the truth of characteristics, the truth of distinctions, the truth of definite discernment, the truth of things, the truth of going forth,

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i bden pa dang / lam la 'jug pa'i shes pa'i bden pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'byung pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i bden pa dang / lam la 'jug pa'i shes pa'i bden pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'byung pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: the truth of the knowledge of exhaustion and non-arising, the truth of the knowledge of engaging the path, and the truth of the arising of the TathƒÅgata‚Äôs wisdom.

original: de la tshad ma dang 'brel bas yul dang dus yongs su bcad cing gzhan gyi rkyen gyi dbang las skyes pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshad ma dang 'brel bas yul dang dus yongs su bcad cing gzhan gyi rkyen gyi dbang las skyes pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: Among these, the conventional truth is that which is limited to a place and time due to its connection with valid cognition, and which arises from the power of other conditions.

original: stong pa nyid zab mo dang so sor ldan pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid zab mo dang so sor ldan pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The ultimate truth is that which is endowed with profound emptiness.

original: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis na sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis na sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Because of the characteristics of the afflictions, there is suffering.

original: rab tu byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis na kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis na kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: Because of the characteristics of going forth, there is the origin.

original: zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyis na 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyis na 'gog pa'o //
translated: Cessation is characterized by peace.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis na lam mo zhes brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis na lam mo zhes brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bden pa'o //
translated: The path is characterized by definite emergence.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du mtshan nyid gcig pa las de rnams kyi skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis rnam par bye ste bstan pa ni rnam par phye ba'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du mtshan nyid gcig pa las de rnams kyi skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis rnam par bye ste bstan pa ni rnam par phye ba'i bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of differentiation is that which is taught by differentiating those [four noble truths] in terms of their modes of non-production, non-cessation, etc., from the perspective of their single characteristic as the nature of emptiness.

original: nges pa'i don la nges par 'dzin cing mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i don la nges par 'dzin cing mngon par rtogs pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: The truth of realization is the cognition that definitely apprehends and realizes the definitive meaning.

original: shes pa dang shes bya de ni slu bar mi 'gyur bas na nges par phye ste /
analyzed: shes pa dang shes bya de ni slu bar mi 'gyur bas na nges par phye ste /
translated: Since that cognition and its object are not deceptive, they are definitely differentiated.

original: rtogs pa'i bden pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i bden pa zhes brjod do //
translated: That is called the truth of realization.

original: dngos po ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa ste /
translated: Things refer to the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so forth.

original: de rnams ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhes gang gi tshe shes pa na de dag ni dngos po med pa'o zhes rtogs pa ni dngos po'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'o zhes gang gi tshe shes pa na de dag ni dngos po med pa'o zhes rtogs pa ni dngos po'i bden pa'o //
translated: When one understands that all of these are dependently arisen, one realizes that they are not real things.

original: gang dang gang la nan tan du byas pas nyon mongs pa spong bar nus pa rab tu 'byung ba de ni rab tu 'byung ba'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang la nan tan du byas pas nyon mongs pa spong bar nus pa rab tu 'byung ba de ni rab tu 'byung ba'i bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of going forth is that which is able to eliminate the afflictions through practice, and that is going forth.

original: 'dus bras thams cad ni zad par mthong ba zad pa la ni zad pa med do //
analyzed: 'dus bras thams cad ni zad par mthong ba zad pa la ni zad pa med do //
translated: The truth of cessation is the insight that all conditioned things are exhausted, and that exhaustion is not exhausted.

original: gang zag pa med pa de ni mi skye ba ste /
analyzed: gang zag pa med pa de ni mi skye ba ste /
translated: The truth of non-arising is the non-arising of the person who is without outflows.

original: de ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: These are the truths of the knowledge of exhaustion and non-arising.

original: ye shes kyi lam gang gis bsod nams dang ye shes bsags nas chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par shes pa la 'jug par byed pa de ni lam la 'jug pa'i shes @9b pa'i bden pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ye shes kyi lam gang gis bsod nams dang ye shes bsags nas chos thams cad skye ba med pa dang 'gag pa med par shes pa la 'jug par byed pa de ni lam la 'jug pa'i shes @9b pa'i bden pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The truth of the knowledge of entering the path is said to be the path of wisdom by which one accumulates merit and wisdom and enters the knowledge that all phenomena are unborn and unceasing.

original: chos kyi sprin gyis la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dngos po thams cad kyi yul la kun du 'byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'byung ba'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sprin gyis la de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dngos po thams cad kyi yul la kun du 'byung ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes yang dag par 'byung ba'i bden pa ste /
translated: The cloud of Dharma is the truth of the arising of the Tathagata's gnosis, which arises with regard to all things.

original: bden pa bcu po de'i tshig dang don gang yin pa de ston pa'i dgos pa'i don yod pas na don bcu'i don to //
analyzed: bden pa bcu po de'i tshig dang don gang yin pa de ston pa'i dgos pa'i don yod pas na don bcu'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the ten topics is the meaning of the words and meanings of those ten truths, which have the purpose of teaching.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi dbang por gyur pas na thub dbang ngo //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi dbang por gyur pas na thub dbang ngo //
translated: The Lord of Sages is so called because he is the lord of the faculties of sravakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The ten powers of the Tathagata are as follows:

original: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las dang rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las dang rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: The power of knowing what is possible and impossible, the power of knowing the ripening of karma, the power of knowing various dhƒÅtus, the power of knowing various aspirations, the power of knowing superior and non-superior faculties,

original: kun du 'gro ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang /
translated: the power of knowing one‚Äôs former states,üîΩthe power of knowing deaths and transmigrations,

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs te /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs te /
translated: and the power of knowing the exhaustion of defilements.

original: stobs de rnams dang ldan pas na stobs bcu'o //
analyzed: stobs de rnams dang ldan pas na stobs bcu'o //
translated: Because he has these ten powers, he is the one with the ten powers.

original: thams cad du khyab pas na khyab pa'i bdag go //
analyzed: thams cad du khyab pas na khyab pa'i bdag go //
translated: Because he pervades everything, he is the all-pervading lord.

original: mos pa sna tshogs pa'i dbye bas rab tu phye ba'i sems can ma lus pa kun gyi thar pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don skal ba ji lta ba bzhin mdzad pas na kun gyi don ni ma lus byed do //
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs pa'i dbye bas rab tu phye ba'i sems can ma lus pa kun gyi thar pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don skal ba ji lta ba bzhin mdzad pas na kun gyi don ni ma lus byed do //
translated: Because he acts for the benefit of all beings, who are differentiated by their various aspirations, in accordance with their individual fortunes, he is the one who acts for the benefit of all without exception.

original: dbang rnam pa bcu ni tshe la dbang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang pa dang ; las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang / mos pa la dbang ba dang /üîΩsmos lam la dbang ba dang / ye shes la dbang ba dang / chos la dbang ba ste /
analyzed: dbang rnam pa bcu ni tshe la dbang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang / yo byad la dbang pa dang ; las la dbang ba dang / skye ba la dbang ba dang / rdzu 'phrul la dbang ba dang / mos pa la dbang ba dang / smos lam la dbang ba dang / ye shes la dbang ba dang / chos la dbang ba ste /
translated: The ten masteries are mastery over: life, mind, requisites, action, birth, aspiration, resolution, supernormal powers, pristine awareness, and Dharma.

original: dbang bcu po de rnams dang ldan pas na rnam pa bcu'i dbang ldan che ba po'o //
analyzed: dbang bcu po de rnams dang ldan pas na rnam pa bcu'i dbang ldan che ba po'o //
translated: The great one who possesses the ten masteries is the great one who possesses the ten masteries.

original: thog ma nyid med pas na thog ma med pa ste /
analyzed: thog ma nyid med pas na thog ma med pa ste /
translated: Since it is without beginning, it is beginningless.

original: gal te thog ma yod par gyur na ni rgyu med par 'gyur bas na rtag tu yod pa dang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te thog ma yod par gyur na ni rgyu med par 'gyur bas na rtag tu yod pa dang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it had a beginning, it would be without a cause and would be both existent and nonexistent.

original: phyi dang nang gi spros pas ma bsgribs pa'i bdag nyid can gang yin pa de ni spros pa med pa'i bdag go //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi spros pas ma bsgribs pa'i bdag nyid can gang yin pa de ni spros pa med pa'i bdag go //
translated: The nature that is not obscured by the elaborations of the internal and external is the nature that is without elaborations.

original: dus thams cad du de bzhin du gnas pas na @10a * //
analyzed: dus thams cad du de bzhin du gnas pas na @10a * //
translated: Since it always abides in that way,

original: de bzhin nyid bdag go //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid bdag go //
translated: it is the nature that is suchness.

original: de nyid kyis na dag pa'i bdag go //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na dag pa'i bdag go //
translated: Thus, he is the pure self.

original: bden pa ni mi slu zhing ma log pa'i chos kyi de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: bden pa ni mi slu zhing ma log pa'i chos kyi de kho na nyid do //
translated: The truth is the reality of things that is undeceiving and nonerroneous.

original: de gsung ba'i ngang tshul mnga' bas na bden par smra ba'o //
analyzed: de gsung ba'i ngang tshul mnga' bas na bden par smra ba'o //
translated: Since he has the nature of teaching that, he is the speaker of the truth.

original: gzhan slu ba'i tshig mi gsung bas na tshig mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan slu ba'i tshig mi gsung bas na tshig mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Since he does not speak words that deceive others, he is the one of unchanging speech.

original: dam bcas pa'i don rdzogs par mdzad pas na ji skad smras pa'o //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don rdzogs par mdzad pas na ji skad smras pa'o //
translated: Since he fulfills the meaning of his promises, he is the one who does what he says.

original: 'gro ba la phan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas su grub par gyur cig ces dam bcas pa bzhin du rdzogs par mdzad pas na de bzhin byed do //
analyzed: 'gro ba la phan pa'i phyir sangs rgyas su grub par gyur cig ces dam bcas pa bzhin du rdzogs par mdzad pas na de bzhin byed do //
translated: Since he fulfills his promise to attain buddhahood for the benefit of the world, he is the one who acts accordingly.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'am shes pa dang shes par bya ba gnyis ni gzugs la sogs pa gzung bar bya ba dang mig la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa nas ji srid du yid nas chos kyi bar ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'am shes pa dang shes par bya ba gnyis ni gzugs la sogs pa gzung bar bya ba dang mig la sogs pa 'dzin par byed pa nas ji srid du yid nas chos kyi bar ni gnyis te /
translated: The duality of apprehendeds and apprehenders or of consciousnesses and objects of consciousness is from form as the apprehended and eye as the apprehender up to mind and phenomena.

original: gnyis po de dag med pas na gnyis su med pa ngang ngo //
analyzed: gnyis po de dag med pas na gnyis su med pa ngang ngo //
translated: Since those two do not exist, he is the one of nondual nature.

original: de ston pa ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / stong pa nyid dang / gnyis su med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / chos kyi sku dang / chos nyid do zhes 'chad de de ltar ji srid du gnas pa rnam pa dag pa gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo bcom ldan 'das kyang gnyis su med pa ste /
analyzed: de ston pa ni yang dag pa'i kun rdzob tu de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / stong pa nyid dang / gnyis su med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / chos kyi sku dang / chos nyid do zhes 'chad de de ltar ji srid du gnas pa rnam pa dag pa gnyis su med pa'i de bzhin nyid kyi ngo bo bcom ldan 'das kyang gnyis su med pa ste /
translated: The Bhagavat is also nondual, the nature of the nondual reality of suchness, which is pure in all ways and abides in that way.

original: yang dag pa'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: That is the true reality.

original: de'i mtha' ni mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mtha' ni mthar thug pa ste /
translated: The limit of that is the ultimate.

original: de las gzhan ba'i de kho na nyid do //
analyzed: de las gzhan ba'i de kho na nyid do //
translated: There is no other reality beyond that.

original: de'i mtha' ni mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mtha' ni mthar thug pa ste /
translated: The limit of that is the ultimate.üîΩThere is no other reality beyond that.

original: de las gzhan pa'i de kho na nyid yod pa ma yin pas yang dag pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i de kho na nyid yod pa ma yin pas yang dag pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: Therefore, it is the ultimate limit.

original: der ni de'i bdag nyid kyis thams cad mi g-yo ba chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul gyis der gnas pas na yang dag mtha' la rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: der ni de'i bdag nyid kyis thams cad mi g-yo ba chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul gyis der gnas pas na yang dag mtha' la rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: Since everything is immovable by nature in that reality, it is the ultimate limit, and since it abides in that reality by the principle of the dharmadhatu, it is the one who abides in the ultimate limit.

original: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa la zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyi dregs pa sel ba'i ngo bo nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa la zhugs pa'i sems can rnams kyi dregs pa sel ba'i ngo bo nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of the removal of the pride of sentient beings who are engaged in the manifest clinging to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚ÄùüîΩhe says,

original: bdag med seng ge'i sgra dang ldan //üîΩmu stegs ri dags ngan 'jigs byed //
analyzed: bdag med seng ge'i sgra dang ldan // mu stegs ri dags ngan 'jigs byed //
translated: Endowed with the lion‚Äôs roar of selflessness,

original: ces gsungs te /
analyzed: ces gsungs te /
translated: he terrifies the evil beasts of the extremists.

original: bdag dang bral bas na bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang bral bas na bdag med pa ste /
translated: Since it is free from ‚ÄúI,‚Äù it is selfless.

original: bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na bdag med pa dang ldan la /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na bdag med pa dang ldan la /
translated: Since it has the nature of selflessness, it is endowed with selflessness.

original: seng ge ltar 'jigs pa dang bral ba'i sgra sgrogs pa gang yin pa de ni seng ge'i sgra dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: seng ge ltar 'jigs pa dang bral ba'i sgra sgrogs pa gang yin pa de ni seng ge'i sgra dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Since it proclaims the roar that is free from fear like a lion, it is endowed with the lion‚Äôs roar.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba'i seng ge'i sgra'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa'o zhes bya ba'i seng ge'i sgra'o //
translated: The lion‚Äôs roar is ‚ÄúAll phenomena are selfless.‚Äù

original: ngan pa'i mu la brten pa gang yin pa de ni mu stegs ngan pa'o //
analyzed: ngan pa'i mu la brten pa gang yin pa de ni mu stegs ngan pa'o //
translated: Those who rely on evil views are evil extremists.

original: mu stegs ngan pa ri dags dang 'dra bas na ri dgas so //
analyzed: mu stegs ngan pa ri dags dang 'dra bas na ri dgas so //
translated: Since the evil extremists are like beasts, they are beasts.

original: de @10b rnams 'jigs par byed pas na /
analyzed: de @10b rnams 'jigs par byed pas na /
translated: Since they terrify those,

original: mu stegs ri dgas ngan 'jigs byed //üîΩces bya ste /
analyzed: mu stegs ri dgas ngan 'jigs byed //üîΩces bya ste /
translated: he terrifies the evil beasts of the extremists.

original: chad par smra ba la sogs pa dang bdag yod par khas len pa la sogs pa rnams la bdag med pa dang ldan pa'i chos ston pas na skrag par mdzad ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: chad par smra ba la sogs pa dang bdag yod par khas len pa la sogs pa rnams la bdag med pa dang ldan pa'i chos ston pas na skrag par mdzad ces pa'i don to //
translated: He terrifies the nihilists, etc., and those who accept the existence of a self, by teaching the Dharma endowed with selflessness.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na kun du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na kun du 'gro ba ste /
translated: It is omnipresent, because it is the nature of the dharmadhatu.

original: gang gi phyir chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa'i chos 'ga' yang med pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos kyi dbyings las ma gtogs pa'i chos 'ga' yang med pas so //
translated: Because there is no dharma whatsoever that is outside the dharmadhatu.

original: sems can rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir thams cad du don yod cing thogs pa med pa'i bgrod pa gang la yod pa de ni don yod stobs so //
analyzed: sems can rnams gdul bar bya ba'i phyir thams cad du don yod cing thogs pa med pa'i bgrod pa gang la yod pa de ni don yod stobs so //
translated: It is Amoghasiddhi, because it has the unimpeded, unfailing progress everywhere for the sake of disciplining sentient beings.

original: sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams ji ltar gshegs pa de bzhin du gshegs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi sangs rgyas rnams ji ltar gshegs pa de bzhin du gshegs pas na de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: It is Tathagata, because it goes thus as the former Buddhas went.

original: yid bzhin du mgyogs pas yid ltar mgyogs pa ste /
analyzed: yid bzhin du mgyogs pas yid ltar mgyogs pa ste /
translated: It is Manasaroja, because it is swift like thought.

original: yid kyi shugs kyis dam pa'i chos kyi tshigs su bcad pa gtang ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyi shugs kyis dam pa'i chos kyi tshigs su bcad pa gtang ba'o //
translated: It is Dharmanirghosa, because it emits the verses of the Dharma with the speed of thought.

original: sdig pa'i chos rnams las rgyal bas na rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos rnams las rgyal bas na rgyal ba'o //
translated: It is Jina, because it is victorious over evil dharmas.

original: smra ba rnams kyi nang na khyad par du rgyal ba mnga' bas na rnam par rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: smra ba rnams kyi nang na khyad par du rgyal ba mnga' bas na rnam par rgyal ba'o //
translated: He is the Victorious One because he is victorious over all the other teachers.

original: phyi rol gyi bdud la sogs pa'i dgra las rnam par rgyal bas na dgra las rgyal ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bdud la sogs pa'i dgra las rnam par rgyal bas na dgra las rgyal ba'o //
translated: He is the Conqueror because he has conquered all the enemies, such as Mara, and so forth.

original: yi ge gcig pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba brnyes pas na 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
analyzed: yi ge gcig pa'i 'khor los sgyur ba brnyes pas na 'khor los sgyur ba'o //
translated: He is the Chakravartin because he has attained the single-syllabled Chakravartin.

original: bdud rnams kyis zil gyis mi non pas na stobs po che'o ;
analyzed: bdud rnams kyis zil gyis mi non pas na stobs po che'o ;
translated: He is the Mahabala because he is not overcome by the Maras.

original: / nyan thos kyi tshogs kyi bslab pa'i chos ston pas na tshogs kyi slob dpon no //
analyzed: / nyan thos kyi tshogs kyi bslab pa'i chos ston pas na tshogs kyi slob dpon no //
translated: He is the Sangha-acharya because he teaches the Dharma of training for the assembly of Shravakas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi gtso bor gyur pas na tshogs kyi mchog go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshogs kyi gtso bor gyur pas na tshogs kyi mchog go //
translated: He is the Sangha-agra because he is the chief of the assembly of Bodhisattvas.

original: dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i lha la sogs pa'i tshogs kyi mnga' bdag tu gyur pas na tshogs rje'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la gnas pa'i lha la sogs pa'i tshogs kyi mnga' bdag tu gyur pas na tshogs rje'o //
translated: He is the Sangha-pati because he is the lord of the assembly of gods and so forth that abide in the mandala.

original: phyi rol gyi lha dang lha ma yin gyi bdag por gyur pas na tshogs bdag go //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi lha dang lha ma yin gyi bdag por gyur pas na tshogs bdag go //
translated: He is the Ganapati because he is the lord of the external gods and asuras.

original: bdag por gyur pa'i dbang thob pas na dbang dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag por gyur pa'i dbang thob pas na dbang dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is the Vaishravana because he has attained the power of lordship.

original: sems can thams cad kyi steng du mthu chen po mnga' bas na mthu chen no //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi steng du mthu chen po mnga' bas na mthu chen no //
translated: He is the Great Power because he has great power over all sentient beings.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi gces pa dang ldan pas na gces par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad kyi gces pa dang ldan pas na gces par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He is the Cherisher because he is dear to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyi bdag nyid can yin pas na tshul chen no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyi bdag nyid can yin pas na tshul chen no //
translated: He is the Great Way because he is the embodiment of the Great Vehicle.

original: gzhan rnams kyis bkri mi dgos pas na gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyis bkri mi dgos pas na gzhan gyi dring la mi 'jog pa ste /
translated: He is the One Who Does Not Depend on Others because he does not need to be led by others.

original: gzhan gyis ma bcol bar rang nyid kyis sems can gyi don mdzad ces bya ba'i don to //üîΩdon so so yang dag par rig @11a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma bcol bar rang nyid kyis sems can gyi don mdzad ces bya ba'i don to // don so so yang dag par rig @11a * //
translated: The meaning is that he acts for the welfare of sentient beings on his own, without being asked.

original: pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshig gi dbang phyug tu gyur pas na tshig rje'o //
analyzed: pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi tshig gi dbang phyug tu gyur pas na tshig rje'o //
translated: He is the Lord of Speech because he is the essence of the analytical knowledge of meaning.

original: chos so so yang dag par rig pas chos kyi rjes su rab tu 'jug pas chos ston par mdzad pas na tshig bdag go //
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pas chos kyi rjes su rab tu 'jug pas chos ston par mdzad pas na tshig bdag go //
translated: He is the Master of the Teaching because he teaches the Dharma by engaging in the Dharma through the analytical knowledge of the Dharma.

original: lha dang gnod sbyin dang dri za la sogs pa'i tshig gi lam ji snyed pa'i nges pa'i tshig dang tha snyad de dag thams cad rab tu mkhyen pas de dang de'i sgra dang / de dang de'i nges pa'i tshig gis de rnams la dam pa'i chos ston pas na smra mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang gnod sbyin dang dri za la sogs pa'i tshig gi lam ji snyed pa'i nges pa'i tshig dang tha snyad de dag thams cad rab tu mkhyen pas de dang de'i sgra dang / de dang de'i nges pa'i tshig gis de rnams la dam pa'i chos ston pas na smra mkhas pa'o //
translated: He is skilled in speech because he teaches the true Dharma to those beings by means of their language and their terminology.

original: bud med dang skyes pa dang ma ning la sogs pa'i dbye bas chos rnams rab tu ston pas na tshig la dbang ba'o //
analyzed: bud med dang skyes pa dang ma ning la sogs pa'i dbye bas chos rnams rab tu ston pas na tshig la dbang ba'o //
translated: He is skilled in speech because he teaches the Dharma by means of the distinctions of female, male, neuter, etc.

original: mi rtsub pa dang / cal col ma yin pa dang / snyan pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i tshig gi dbye bas 'dul ba'i thabs dpag tu med pa'i gsung gang la yod pa de ni tshig mtha' yas pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtsub pa dang / cal col ma yin pa dang / snyan pa dang / rnam par dag pa'i tshig gi dbye bas 'dul ba'i thabs dpag tu med pa'i gsung gang la yod pa de ni tshig mtha' yas pa ste /
translated: He has infinite speech because he has an infinite number of ways of guiding, by means of his speech, which is not harsh, not frivolous, pleasant, and pure.

original: de dag gis ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ni spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: By these, he shows the analytical knowledge of ready speech.

original: mi slu ba'i tshig dang ldan pas na tshig bden no //
analyzed: mi slu ba'i tshig dang ldan pas na tshig bden no //
translated: He has true speech because he has nondeceptive speech.

original: bden pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: bden pa ni de bzhin nyid kyi dbyings so //
translated: The truth is the expanse of reality.

original: bden par smra ba'i ngang tshul mda' bas na bden par smra ba'o //
analyzed: bden par smra ba'i ngang tshul mda' bas na bden par smra ba'o //
translated: He is truthful because he is more truthful than an arrow.

original: bden pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: bden pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four truths:

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam ste /
translated: the truth of suffering, the truth of the origin of suffering, the truth of the cessation of suffering, and the truth of the path.

original: bden pa bzhi po de dag ston pas na bden pa bzhi ni ston pa po'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi po de dag ston pas na bden pa bzhi ni ston pa po'o //
translated: He is the teacher of the four truths because he teaches those four truths.

original: sa brgyad pa la bla na med pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pas phyir mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: sa brgyad pa la bla na med pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog pas phyir mi ldog pa'o //
translated: He is irreversible because he is irreversible from unexcelled enlightenment on the eighth stage.

original: 'khor bar mi 'ong bas na phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor bar mi 'ong bas na phyir mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: He is a non-returner because he does not come back to cyclic existence.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi gtso bor gyur pas na 'dren pa rang rgyal bse ru'i tshul lo //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi lam gyi gtso bor gyur pas na 'dren pa rang rgyal bse ru'i tshul lo //
translated: He is the leader of the pratyekabuddhas because he is the principal one on the pratyekabuddha path.

original: 'dis sems can rnams nges par 'byung bas na nges par 'byung ba ste lam mo //
analyzed: 'dis sems can rnams nges par 'byung bas na nges par 'byung ba ste lam mo //
translated: He is the definite emergence because he is the path that definitely leads sentient beings out of cyclic existence.

original: des na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang 'bras bu'i tshul gyis der bdag nyid lam dang 'bras bu'i tshul gyis gzugs su rab tu ston pas na nges 'byung sna tshogs las byung ba'o //
analyzed: des na nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi lam dang 'bras bu'i tshul gyis der bdag nyid lam dang 'bras bu'i tshul gyis gzugs su rab tu ston pas na nges 'byung sna tshogs las byung ba'o //
translated: Thus, he is the one who has arisen from various liberations, since he manifests himself in the form of the paths and fruits of the disciples and the solitary sages.

original: 'byung ba chen po ni rdzu 'phrul can no //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po ni rdzu 'phrul can no //
translated: He is the great being, since he is the one who has attained the great enlightenment.

original: de sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i rgyu gcig pu ni bcom ldan 'das nyid yin pas na 'byung ba chen po rgyu gcig pu'o //
analyzed: de sangs rgyas nyid thob pa'i rgyu gcig pu ni bcom ldan 'das nyid yin pas na 'byung ba chen po rgyu gcig pu'o //
translated: He is the one who has arisen from the great element, since the Blessed One alone is the cause for attaining buddhahood.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bral bas na dge slong ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bral bas na dge slong ngo //
translated: He is the monk, since he is free from the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dgra bcom pas na dgra bcom mo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dgra bcom pas na dgra bcom mo //
translated: He is the arhat, since he is the foe-destroyer of the afflictions.

original: nang gi nyon mongs pa'i gang zag pa zad pa gang yin pa de ni zag pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi nyon mongs pa'i gang zag pa zad pa gang yin pa de ni zag pa zad pa'o //
translated: He is the one whose outflows have dried up, since he has exhausted the individual outflows of the internal afflictions.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / @11b gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags gang gis spangs shing bor ba de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / @11b gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags gang gis spangs shing bor ba de ni 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: He is the one who is free from attachment, since he has abandoned and rejected the attachments of the desire realm, the attachments of the form realm, and the attachments of the formless realm.

original: dbang po thul bas yul la 'jug pa las zlog pa gang yin pa de dbang po thul ba'o //
analyzed: dbang po thul bas yul la 'jug pa las zlog pa gang yin pa de dbang po thul ba'o //
translated: The faculty of mastery is the turning away from engagement with objects due to the subduing of the faculties.

original: nye bar dmigs pa'i nye bar len pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bas na bde ba rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar dmigs pa'i nye bar len pa'i nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len thams cad dang bral bas na bde ba rnyed pa'o //
translated: The attainment of bliss is due to being free from all the negative tendencies of the afflictions that appropriate the objects of observation.

original: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid thob pas na 'jigs med thob ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid thob pas na 'jigs med thob ba'o //
translated: The attainment of fearlessness is due to attaining the sameness of all phenomena.

original: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba sel bas na bsil bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nyon mongs pa'i gdung ba sel bas na bsil bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The state of coolness is due to dispelling the heat of the afflictions of all sentient beings.

original: rnyog pa ni dri ma dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rnyog pa ni dri ma dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Turbidity is impurity.

original: dri ma med pas na rnyog pa med de nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dri ma med pas na rnyog pa med de nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Since it is stainless, it is non-turbid, free from afflictions.

original: des na gang gi phyir rnyog pa thams cad dang bral ba de'i phyir rnyog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: des na gang gi phyir rnyog pa thams cad dang bral ba de'i phyir rnyog pa med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because it is free from all turbidity, it is non-turbid.

original: mi slob pa'i rig pa gsum dang / mi slob pa'i lus dang ngag sdom pa'i 'tsho ba la sogs pa'i rkang pa dang ldan pas na rig pa dang ni rkang par ldan no //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i rig pa gsum dang / mi slob pa'i lus dang ngag sdom pa'i 'tsho ba la sogs pa'i rkang pa dang ldan pas na rig pa dang ni rkang par ldan no //
translated: It is endowed with knowledge and feet because it possesses the three knowledges of a non-learner and the feet of livelihood and so on of the vows of a non-learner's body and speech.

original: phyir mi ldog par gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par gshegs pas na bde bar gshegs pa ste /
translated: He is the Well-Gone because he has gone to the state of no return.

original: rims nang las legs par byang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rims nang las legs par byang ba bzhin no //
translated: He is like one who has been cured of a contagious disease.

original: 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / rigs kyi dbye bas phye ba'i sems can gyi 'jig rten ji lta ba bzhin mkhyen pas na 'jig rten rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / skye gnas dang / rigs kyi dbye bas phye ba'i sems can gyi 'jig rten ji lta ba bzhin mkhyen pas na 'jig rten rig pa'o //
translated: He is the Knower of the World because he knows the world of sentient beings, which is differentiated by its migrations, birthplaces, and social classes.

original: thams cad kyi dam par gyur pas na mchog go //
analyzed: thams cad kyi dam par gyur pas na mchog go //
translated: He is the Supreme because he is the best of all.

original: 'di ni bdag gi'o zhes bdag gi ba med pas na bdag gir mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi'o zhes bdag gi ba med pas na bdag gir mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He is the Non-Apprehending of Mine because he does not apprehend ‚Äúmine‚Äù as ‚Äúthis is mine.‚Äù

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rkyen gyi bdag gi ngo bo med pas na ngar mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rkyen gyi bdag gi ngo bo med pas na ngar mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: He is the Non-Apprehending of ‚ÄúI‚Äù because he does not apprehend ‚ÄúI‚Äù as the nature of ‚Äúmine,‚Äù which is the condition for the apprehension of ‚ÄúI.‚Äù

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis po de nyid tshul te gzhung lugs so //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis po de nyid tshul te gzhung lugs so //
translated: The method is the system of those two, conventional and ultimate truths.

original: der gnas par mdzad pas na bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: der gnas par mdzad pas na bden pa gnyis kyi tshul la gnas pa'o //
translated: He is the Abider in the Method of the Two Truths because he abides in that.

original: 'khor ba ni dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gro dang / mi dang / lha'i srid par yang dang yang du 'khor bas 'khor ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba ni dmyal ba dang / yi dags dang / dud 'gro dang / mi dang / lha'i srid par yang dang yang du 'khor bas 'khor ba'o //
translated: Samsara is the repeated cycling in the existences of hell beings, hungry ghosts, animals, humans, and gods.

original: de'i pha rol tu son pas na 'khor ba'i pha rol tu son pa'o //
analyzed: de'i pha rol tu son pas na 'khor ba'i pha rol tu son pa'o //
translated: He has gone to the other shore of cyclic existence, because he has gone to the other shore of the ocean of cyclic existence.

original: de'i mtha' ni mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: de'i mtha' ni mthar thug pa ste /
translated: The end of that is the ultimate,

original: der gnas pas na 'khor ba'i pha rol mthar son pa'o //
analyzed: der gnas pas na 'khor ba'i pha rol mthar son pa'o //
translated: and he abides in that, because he has gone to the other shore of cyclic existence.

original: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: 'khor ba'i ngo bo nyid yongs su skye ba med par mkhyen la de med na mya ngan las 'das pa yang med pas mi gnas pa la bzhugs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i ngo bo nyid yongs su skye ba med par mkhyen la de med na mya ngan las 'das pa yang med pas mi gnas pa la bzhugs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He knows that the reality of cyclic existence is completely non-arisen, and since there is no nirvana without that, he abides in the non-abiding.

original: sems can ma lus pa'i don mdzad pas na bya ba byas pa'o //üîΩbsod nams dang ye shes @12a * //
analyzed: sems can ma lus pa'i don mdzad pas na bya ba byas pa'o // bsod nams dang ye shes @12a * //
translated: He has done what was to be done, because he has acted for the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: kyi tshogs dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i thabs thams cad las mthong ba'i gnas su bzhugs pas na skam sar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: kyi tshogs dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i thabs thams cad las mthong ba'i gnas su bzhugs pas na skam sar gnas pa'o //
translated: He has reached the dry ground, because he has reached the dry ground of the stage of seeing, which is the means of the perfections and the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: grangs can la sogs pas yongs su brtags pa'i 'ba' zhig pa'i rgyu bdag la sogs pa las byung ba dgag pa'i phyir shes pa 'ba' zhig nges gsal ba'o //
analyzed: grangs can la sogs pas yongs su brtags pa'i 'ba' zhig pa'i rgyu bdag la sogs pa las byung ba dgag pa'i phyir shes pa 'ba' zhig nges gsal ba'o //
translated: He has made consciousness alone manifest, because he has refuted the self and so on, which are the causes of the mere thing imputed by the SƒÅ·πÉkhya and so on.

original: shes rab nyid mtshon cha ste shes rab mtshon cha gang yin pa de ni shes rab mtshon cha'o //
analyzed: shes rab nyid mtshon cha ste shes rab mtshon cha gang yin pa de ni shes rab mtshon cha'o //
translated: Wisdom itself is the weapon, and that which is the weapon of wisdom is the weapon of wisdom.

original: des sems can rnams kyi log pa'i blo gros 'jig pas na rnam par 'joms pa'o //
analyzed: des sems can rnams kyi log pa'i blo gros 'jig pas na rnam par 'joms pa'o //
translated: It is the destroyer of the false wisdom of beings, and so it is the destroyer.

original: dam pa'i chos ston pas na dam chos so //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ston pas na dam chos so //
translated: It is the holy Dharma, and so it is the holy Dharma.

original: chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur bas dbang bskur ba'i phyir chos rgyal lo //üîΩsems can rnams kyi rgyu la gnas pa'i ma rig pa'i mun pa rnam par sel bas na gsal bar ldan no //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal por dbang bskur bas dbang bskur ba'i phyir chos rgyal lo // sems can rnams kyi rgyu la gnas pa'i ma rig pa'i mun pa rnam par sel bas na gsal bar ldan no //
translated: It is the Dharma King, and so it is the Dharma King.üîΩIt is the light of the world, and so it is the light of the world.

original: ye shes kyi 'od zer rnam par 'phro ba shin tu rgyas pas sems can rnams kyi snang ba mdzad pas na 'jig rten snang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi 'od zer rnam par 'phro ba shin tu rgyas pas sems can rnams kyi snang ba mdzad pas na 'jig rten snang bar byed pa'o //
translated: It is the light of the world, and so it is the light of the world.

original: dam pa yin pas na mchog go ;
analyzed: dam pa yin pas na mchog go ;
translated: It is the supreme, and so it is the supreme.üîΩIt is the lord of Dharma, and so it is the lord of Dharma.

original: / chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur zhing chos thams cad la rab tu 'jug pa de la rag las pas na chos kyi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: / chos thams cad la dbang bsgyur zhing chos thams cad la rab tu 'jug pa de la rag las pas na chos kyi dbang phyug go //
translated: It is the lord of Dharma, and so it is the lord of Dharma.

original: 'khor gyi dbus na chos kyis mdzes pas na chos kyi rgyal po'o //
analyzed: 'khor gyi dbus na chos kyis mdzes pas na chos kyi rgyal po'o //
translated: He is the King of Dharma because he is beautiful with Dharma in the midst of his retinue.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'phags pa'i lam nye bar ston pas na legs pa'i lam ni ston pa po'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i 'phags pa'i lam nye bar ston pas na legs pa'i lam ni ston pa po'o //
translated: He is the teacher of the good path because he teaches the noble path which is conducive to nirvana.

original: don ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dgos pa'o //
analyzed: don ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dgos pa'o //
translated: The aim is the purpose which has the characteristics of the levels and transcendent perfections.

original: grub pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa gang yin pa de ni don grub bo //
analyzed: grub pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa gang yin pa de ni don grub bo //
translated: The achievement is the accomplishment of that aim.

original: sngon byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs na sangs rgyas nyid 'thob bar bya'o zhes yang dag par rtogs pa'i bsam pa grub pas na bsam pa grub pa'o //
analyzed: sngon byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs na sangs rgyas nyid 'thob bar bya'o zhes yang dag par rtogs pa'i bsam pa grub pas na bsam pa grub pa'o //
translated: He is the one who has achieved his intention because he has achieved the intention to attain buddhahood, which he formed when he was a bodhisattva.

original: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i gnas skabs na ma rig pa las byung ba'i rtog pa spangs pas kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa'i gnas skabs na ma rig pa las byung ba'i rtog pa spangs pas kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'o //
translated: He is the one who has eliminated all conceptual thoughts because he has eliminated the conceptual thoughts that arise from ignorance on the level of the purity of the expanse of reality.

original: gang gi phyir kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs pa de nyid kyis na rnam par mi rtog dbyings mi zad de chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir kun du rtog pa thams cad spangs pa de nyid kyis na rnam par mi rtog dbyings mi zad de chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: Because it is the very abandonment of all conceptualization, it is the inexhaustible realm of non-conceptuality, the realm of the Dharma.

original: mchog tu phul du byung bas dam pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu phul du byung bas dam pa'o //
translated: It is the highest, the most excellent.

original: nam yang dngos gzhan du mi 'gyur bas na zad mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: nam yang dngos gzhan du mi 'gyur bas na zad mi shes pa'o //
translated: It is inexhaustible, never changing into something else.

original: gang la bsod nams yod pa de ni bsod nams dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gang la bsod nams yod pa de ni bsod nams dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is the merit, because it is the basis of merit.

original: de la mchod pa byed pa'i sems can rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs bskyed pas na bsod nams tshogs so //
analyzed: de la mchod pa byed pa'i sems can rnams kyi bsod nams kyi tshogs bskyed pas na bsod nams tshogs so //
translated: It is the accumulation of merit, because it generates the accumulation of merit of those beings who worship it.

original: rtag tu gnyis su @12b med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na ye shes so //
analyzed: rtag tu gnyis su @12b med pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na ye shes so //
translated: It is the intuition, because it is always the essence of non-dual intuition.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi gnas su gyur pas na ye shes kyi 'byung gnas so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi gnas su gyur pas na ye shes kyi 'byung gnas so //
translated: It is the intuition-source, because it is the basis of omniscient intuition.

original: thams cad du mchod pa yin pas che ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad du mchod pa yin pas che ba'o //
translated: It is the great, because it is worshipped everywhere.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i yongs su mkhyen pa mnga' bas na ye shes ldan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i yongs su mkhyen pa mnga' bas na ye shes ldan pa'o //
translated: It is the intuition-possessor, because it possesses the intuition of omniscience.

original: dngos po rnams kyi yod pa dang med pa nyid kyis 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ston pa'i ye shes mnga' bas na yod med shes so //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi yod pa dang med pa nyid kyis 'byung ba dang 'jig pa ston pa'i ye shes mnga' bas na yod med shes so //
translated: He knows existence and nonexistence because he possesses the intuition that reveals becoming and destruction through the existence and nonexistence of things.

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par rdzogs pas na tshogs gnyis tshogs ni bsags pa po'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par rdzogs pas na tshogs gnyis tshogs ni bsags pa po'o //
translated: He is the accumulator of the stores of merit and intuition because he has perfected the stores of merit and intuition.

original: thams cad du rab tu 'brel ba'i gzugs kyis gnas pas na rtag pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du rab tu 'brel ba'i gzugs kyis gnas pas na rtag pa'o //
translated: He is eternal because he abides in the form of a close connection with all.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i 'gro ba kun du mdzes pas na kun rgyal lo //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i 'gro ba kun du mdzes pas na kun rgyal lo //
translated: He is the universal monarch because he is beautiful in all migrations.

original: bla na med pa'i shes rab dang / thabs dang / ye shes dang ldan pas na rnal 'byor can no //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i shes rab dang / thabs dang / ye shes dang ldan pas na rnal 'byor can no //
translated: He is the yogi because he possesses the unexcelled wisdom, method, and intuition.

original: bsam gtan dang bsam par bya ba dang bral bas rnam par mi rtog pa'i bsam gtan dang ldan pas na bsam gtan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang bsam par bya ba dang bral bas rnam par mi rtog pa'i bsam gtan dang ldan pas na bsam gtan no //
translated: He is the meditator because he possesses nonconceptual meditation, being free from meditation and the object of meditation.

original: 'tshang rgya ba nyid don du gnyer bas rtag tu bsam par bya ba yin pas na bsam bya'o //
analyzed: 'tshang rgya ba nyid don du gnyer bas rtag tu bsam par bya ba yin pas na bsam bya'o //
translated: He is the object of meditation because he is always the object of meditation for those who seek enlightenment.

original: sems can thams cad kyi shes rab kyi gtso bor gyur pas na blo ldan mchog go //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi shes rab kyi gtso bor gyur pas na blo ldan mchog go //
translated: It is the supreme intelligence, since it is the principal wisdom of all sentient beings.

original: so sor rang rig pa'i bdag nyid yin pas na so so rang rig go //
analyzed: so sor rang rig pa'i bdag nyid yin pas na so so rang rig go //
translated: It is the self-cognizant, since it is the nature of self-awareness.

original: tshul 'di nyid kyis dus thams cad du mi 'gyur bas na mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: tshul 'di nyid kyis dus thams cad du mi 'gyur bas na mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: It is the immutable, since it is immutable at all times in just this way.

original: mchog kyang yin la dang po yang yin pas na mchog gi dang po ste yi ge aa'o //
analyzed: mchog kyang yin la dang po yang yin pas na mchog gi dang po ste yi ge aa'o //
translated: It is the supreme first, since it is the supreme and the first, that is, the syllable A.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na mchog gi dang po'o //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na mchog gi dang po'o //
translated: It is the nature of the supreme first.

original: chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku mnga' bas sku gsum 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i sku mnga' bas sku gsum 'chang ba'o //
translated: It is the bearer of the three bodies, since it possesses the Dharma Body, the Complete Enjoyment Body, and the Transformation Body.

original: chos rnams phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pas na sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: chos rnams phyin ci ma log par thugs su chud pas na sangs rgyas so //
translated: It is the Buddha, since it is the unerring realization of all things.

original: ngo bo nyid dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa dang / chos dang / ye shes te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa dang / chos dang / ye shes te /
translated: The five bodies are the Essential Body, the Complete Enjoyment Body, the Transformation Body, the Dharma Body, and the Knowledge Body.

original: sku lnga po de rnams kyi bdag nyid du gyur pas na sku lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: sku lnga po de rnams kyi bdag nyid du gyur pas na sku lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: It is the embodiment of the five bodies, since it is the nature of those five bodies.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul gyis kun du khyab pas na khyab bdag go //üîΩme long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor rtog pa dang / bya ba grub pa dang / chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi tshul gyis kun du khyab pas na khyab bdag go // me long lta bu dang / mnyam pa nyid dang / so sor rtog pa dang / bya ba grub pa dang / chos kyi dbyings rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: It is the lord of all because it pervades all by the principle of the realm of the Dharma.

original: ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can yin pas na ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can no //üîΩsangs rgyas lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i cod pan na dang ldan @13a * //
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can yin pas na ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can no // sangs rgyas lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i cod pan na dang ldan @13a * //
translated: It is the nature of the five gnoses, mirror-like gnosis, the gnosis of equality, discriminating gnosis, all-accomplishing gnosis, and the pure realm of the Dharma.

original: pas na sangs rgyas lnga bdag cod pan can no //
analyzed: pas na sangs rgyas lnga bdag cod pan can no //
translated: It is the nature of the five buddhas, Vairocana, Ak·π£obhya, Ratnasa·πÉbhava, AmitƒÅbha, and Amoghasiddhi, because it is the crest jewel of the tathƒÅgatas who are the nature of the five buddhas.

original: sha dang / lha dang / chos dang / shes rab dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan te lnga po gang la yod pa de ni spyan lnga'o //
analyzed: sha dang / lha dang / chos dang / shes rab dang / sangs rgyas kyi spyan te lnga po gang la yod pa de ni spyan lnga'o //
translated: It is the five eyes, the flesh eye, the divine eye, the wisdom eye, the Dharma eye, and the buddha eye.

original: chags pa ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa ni 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Attachment is clinging to sa·πÉsƒÅra and nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: de mi mnga' bas na chags pa med pa 'chang ste /
analyzed: de mi mnga' bas na chags pa med pa 'chang ste /
translated: It is free from attachment because it does not have that.

original: 'chang ba ni gnyis su med par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'chang ba ni gnyis su med par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the holder of nonduality.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su shes rab dang thabs kyi tshul gyis sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yum du gyur pas na sangs rgyas thams cad bskyed pa po'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi dbus su shes rab dang thabs kyi tshul gyis sangs rgyas thams cad kyi yum du gyur pas na sangs rgyas thams cad bskyed pa po'o //
translated: In the center of the mandala, he is the mother of all the Buddhas by the method of wisdom and means, and so he is the producer of all the Buddhas.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul gyis bzhugs pas na sangs rgyas sras po'o //üîΩphul du byung bas na dam pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul gyis bzhugs pas na sangs rgyas sras po'o // phul du byung bas na dam pa'o //
translated: He is the son of the Buddhas because he dwells in the manner of a Bodhisattva.üîΩHe is the highest because he is preeminent.

original: rab tu byung bas na mchog go //
analyzed: rab tu byung bas na mchog go //
translated: He is the best because he is fully ordained.

original: shes rab nyid kyi srid pa yin pas na shes rab srid pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab nyid kyi srid pa yin pas na shes rab srid pa'o //
translated: He is the existence of wisdom because wisdom itself is existence.

original: de las byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' yin pas na shes rab srid 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' yin pas na shes rab srid 'byung ngo //
translated: He is the emergence from the existence of wisdom because he is a Bodhisattva who has emerged from that.

original: skye gnas ni rgyu ste /
analyzed: skye gnas ni rgyu ste /
translated: The birthplace is the cause.

original: 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyu mi mnga' bas na skye gnas med pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyu mi mnga' bas na skye gnas med pa'o //
translated: He is without a birthplace because he does not have a cause for birth in cyclic existence.

original: gal te skye ba'i rgyu dang bral na byang chub sems dpar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba'i rgyu dang bral na byang chub sems dpar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If he is free from the cause of birth, how can he be a Bodhisattva?

original: chos las 'byung ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chos las 'byung ba zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The text says, ‚Äúhe is the one who has emerged from the Dharma.‚Äù

original: thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi skye gnas las 'byung bas na chos las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: thabs dang shes rab gnyis su med pa'i chos kyi skye gnas las 'byung bas na chos las 'byung ba'o //
translated: Since it arises from the womb of the Dharma, which is the nondual union of means and wisdom, it is the womb of the Dharma.

original: gang gi phyir chos kyi skye gnas las byung bas na srin pa sel ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos kyi skye gnas las byung bas na srin pa sel ba ste /
translated: Since it arises from the womb of the Dharma, it is the dispeller of the demon,

original: 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyu med pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor bar skye ba'i rgyu med pa'o //
translated: the cause of birth in cyclic existence.

original: srid pa nyid kyi gnyis su med pa'i mkhregs pa gang yin pa de ni gcig pu sra mkhregs te /
analyzed: srid pa nyid kyi gnyis su med pa'i mkhregs pa gang yin pa de ni gcig pu sra mkhregs te /
translated: The single, solid vajra is the nonduality of the solidity of existence itself.

original: khong stong gi rnam pa'i gnyis med pa'o //
analyzed: khong stong gi rnam pa'i gnyis med pa'o //
translated: It is the nonduality of the aspect of hollowness.

original: de nyid kyis na bcom ldan 'das mi phyed pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na rdo rje'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na bcom ldan 'das mi phyed pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas na rdo rje'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Since the BhagavƒÅn is of the nature of the indivisible vajra, he is of the nature of the vajra.

original: skyes ma thag pa ni yi ge h'um ste de las byung zhing 'gro bas na skyes ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: skyes ma thag pa ni yi ge h'um ste de las byung zhing 'gro bas na skyes ma thag pa'o //
translated: The moment of birth is the syllable h≈´·πÉ. Since it arises from that and goes forth, it is the moment of birth.

original: 'gro ba rnams bka' bzhin byed pa'i bdag po yin pas na 'gro ba'i bdag go //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams bka' bzhin byed pa'i bdag po yin pas na 'gro ba'i bdag go //
translated: Since it is the lord of those who act in accordance with the speech of beings, it is the lord of beings.

original: chos rnams nam mkha' dang 'dra bar bstan pa las byung ba gang yin pa de ni nam mkha' las byung ba'o //
analyzed: chos rnams nam mkha' dang 'dra bar bstan pa las byung ba gang yin pa de ni nam mkha' las byung ba'o //
translated: Since it arises from the teaching that phenomena are like space, it is arisen from space.

original: gdul bya'i dbang du de dang de'i gzugs su bdag nyid gyur pas na rang byung ba'o //
analyzed: gdul bya'i dbang du de dang de'i gzugs su bdag nyid gyur pas na rang byung ba'o //
translated: He is self-arisen because he has become the form of this or that in accordance with the disciples.

original: shes rab dang ye shes ni chos thams cad dngos po med par thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang ye shes ni chos thams cad dngos po med par thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: His wisdom and knowledge is the realization that all things are unreal.

original: de nyid nye bar dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bud shing thal bar byed pas na shes rab ye shes me bo che'o //
analyzed: de nyid nye bar dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bud shing thal bar byed pas na shes rab ye shes me bo che'o //
translated: He is the great fire of the wisdom of knowledge because he burns the fuel of the afflictions that are perceived as real.

original: thams cad du chos nyid kyis snang bar byed pas @13b na 'od chen no //
analyzed: thams cad du chos nyid kyis snang bar byed pas @13b na 'od chen no //
translated: He is the great light because he illuminates everything with the light of reality.

original: khyad par du snang zhing gsal bar mdzad pas na rnam par snang byed do //
analyzed: khyad par du snang zhing gsal bar mdzad pas na rnam par snang byed do //
translated: He is the illuminator because he illuminates and makes things clear.

original: ye shes kyi snang bas sems can rnams kyi ma rig pa'i mun pa rnam par sel bas ye shes snang ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi snang bas sems can rnams kyi ma rig pa'i mun pa rnam par sel bas ye shes snang ba'o //
translated: He is the light of knowledge because he dispels the darkness of ignorance of beings with the light of knowledge.

original: ye shes kyi snang ba de sna tshogs snang bas na lam me'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi snang ba de sna tshogs snang bas na lam me'o //
translated: He is the lamp because he is the light of knowledge that shines in many ways.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi 'od zer gyis 'gro ba la snang bar mdzad pas na 'gro ba'i mar me'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi 'od zer gyis 'gro ba la snang bar mdzad pas na 'gro ba'i mar me'o //
translated: He is the world‚Äôs lamp because he illuminates the world with the light of the true Dharma.

original: ye shes kyi sgron mas ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis khebs pa'i sems can rab tu gsal bar mdzad pas na ye shes sgron ma'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi sgron mas ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis khebs pa'i sems can rab tu gsal bar mdzad pas na ye shes sgron ma'o //
translated: He is the Lamp of Wisdom because he illuminates sentient beings who are covered by the darkness of ignorance.

original: gzi brjid chen po dang ldan pas na gzi brjid chen po'o //
analyzed: gzi brjid chen po dang ldan pas na gzi brjid chen po'o //
translated: He is the Great Splendor because he possesses great majesty.

original: rab tu snang ba'i ngang tshul can yin pas na 'od gsal ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu snang ba'i ngang tshul can yin pas na 'od gsal ba'o //
translated: He is the Clear Light because he has the nature of being very bright.

original: gsang sngags kyi gtsor bor gyur pas na sngags mchog mnga' bdag go //üîΩgnod mdzes rgyal po'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na rig sngags rgyal po'o //
analyzed: gsang sngags kyi gtsor bor gyur pas na sngags mchog mnga' bdag go // gnod mdzes rgyal po'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na rig sngags rgyal po'o //
translated: He is the Lord of Supreme Mantra because he is the chief of the mantras.üîΩHe is the King of Knowledge Mantras because he is the essence of the King of Wrathful Ones.

original: yi ge bhr'um gyi bdag nyid can yin pas na gsang sngags rgyal po'o //
analyzed: yi ge bhr'um gyi bdag nyid can yin pas na gsang sngags rgyal po'o //
translated: He is the King of Secret Mantras because he is the essence of the syllable bhr≈´·πÉ.

original: sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pas na don chen byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi don mdzad pas na don chen byed pa'o //
translated: He is the Great Benefactor because he benefits sentient beings.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i yi ge gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na gtsug tor chen po'o //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i yi ge gcig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na gtsug tor chen po'o //
translated: He is the Great U·π£·πáƒ´·π£a because he is the essence of the single-syllable cakravartin.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba nyon mongs pa gdul ba'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na rmad byung gtsug tor ro //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba nyon mongs pa gdul ba'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na rmad byung gtsug tor ro //
translated: He is the Wonderful U·π£·πáƒ´·π£a because he is the essence of the cakravartin who subdues the afflictions.

original: nam mkha' na gnas pa'i zla ba la sogs pa'i bdag por gyur pas na nam mkha'i bdag po'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' na gnas pa'i zla ba la sogs pa'i bdag por gyur pas na nam mkha'i bdag po'o //
translated: He is the lord of the sky because he is the master of the moon and so forth that abide in the sky.

original: gzi brjid phung po'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na sna tshogs ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzi brjid phung po'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas na sna tshogs ston pa'o //
translated: He is the teacher of variety because he is the essence of the aggregate of splendor.

original: yang na sna tshogs pa la mnyam par lta bas na mthong ba'i ngang tshul gang la mnga' ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang na sna tshogs pa la mnyam par lta bas na mthong ba'i ngang tshul gang la mnga' ba de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, he is the one who has the nature of seeing because he views the variety equally.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku'i bdag nyid ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sku'i bdag nyid ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'o //
translated: The nature of the body of all buddhas is Vairocana and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi mchog ni gtso bo ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi mchog ni gtso bo ste /
translated: The supreme of those is the chief one.

original: rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na sangs rgyas kun bdag dngos po'i mchog go //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad chen po'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na sangs rgyas kun bdag dngos po'i mchog go //
translated: He is the supreme entity, the nature of Great Vairocana, because he is the lord of all buddhas.

original: mnyam par blta bas 'gro ba kun la gzigs pas dga' bar byed pa'i spyan gang la yod pa de ni 'gro kun dga' ba'i mig dang ldan no //
analyzed: mnyam par blta bas 'gro ba kun la gzigs pas dga' bar byed pa'i spyan gang la yod pa de ni 'gro kun dga' ba'i mig dang ldan no //
translated: He is the one who has the eyes that delight all beings because he has the eyes that delight all beings by viewing them equally.

original: sna tshogs pa'i skus sems can rnams 'dul bar mdzad pas na sna tshogs gzugs can no //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i skus sems can rnams 'dul bar mdzad pas na sna tshogs gzugs can no //
translated: He is the one who has various forms because he disciplines sentient beings with various bodies.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las yongs su mkhyen pas na skyed pa po'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las yongs su mkhyen pas na skyed pa po'o //
translated: He is the creator because he fully knows virtuous and nonvirtuous actions.

original: tshangs pa la sogs pas mchod pas na mchod pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa la sogs pas mchod pas na mchod pa'o //
translated: He is the worshipped because he is worshipped by Brahma and so forth.

original: mchod yon dang zhal zas la sogs pas rjed par 'os pa yin pas na rjed pa'o //
analyzed: mchod yon dang zhal zas la sogs pas rjed par 'os pa yin pas na rjed pa'o //
translated: He is the revered because he is worthy of being revered with offerings of water for the feet, food, and so forth.

original: @14a * // 'jig rten pa'i drang srong dang nyan thos kyi drang srong rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pas na drang srong chen po'o //
analyzed: @14a * // 'jig rten pa'i drang srong dang nyan thos kyi drang srong rnams kyi mchog tu gyur pas na drang srong chen po'o //
translated: He is the great sage because he is the supreme of worldly sages and of the sages who are disciples.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje dang / padma'i rigs gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyi bdag nyid 'dzin pas na rigs gsum 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang / rdo rje dang / padma'i rigs gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyi bdag nyid 'dzin pas na rigs gsum 'chang ba'o //
translated: He is the bearer of the three lineages because he bears the nature of the three lineages of the Tathagata, the vajra, and the lotus.

original: rigs gsum gyi nang du gtogs pa'i rigs dang gsang sngags thams cad 'dzin pas na gsang sngags 'chang ngo //
analyzed: rigs gsum gyi nang du gtogs pa'i rigs dang gsang sngags thams cad 'dzin pas na gsang sngags 'chang ngo //
translated: He is the bearer of the secret mantra because he bears all the lineages and secret mantras that are included within the three lineages.

original: dam tshig chen po'i sgras ni spyan la sogs pa ston la /
analyzed: dam tshig chen po'i sgras ni spyan la sogs pa ston la /
translated: The term great commitment indicates Locana and so forth.

original: de rnams kyi gsang sngags 'chang bas na dam tshig chen po gsang sngags 'dzin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi gsang sngags 'chang bas na dam tshig chen po gsang sngags 'dzin no //
translated: He is the bearer of the great commitment secret mantra because he bears the secret mantras of those.

original: mchog tu gyur pas na gtso bo'o //
analyzed: mchog tu gyur pas na gtso bo'o //
translated: Since it is the most excellent, it is preeminent.

original: bstan pa 'jig pa bsrung ba'i phyir dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan ston pa sngon du 'gro ba ston pas sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun rnams 'gro ba 'dzin du 'jug pas na dkon mchog gsum 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa 'jig pa bsrung ba'i phyir dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan ston pa sngon du 'gro ba ston pas sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun rnams 'gro ba 'dzin du 'jug pas na dkon mchog gsum 'dzin pa'o //
